content:
© 2024 Accordion     CONFIDENTIAL
Patient targeting & tracking unbilled orders
1
• Tracked patients by their eligibility for a re-supply of medical equipment and 
created a prioritized list of patients to help the client to better target those 
patients.
• Also, tracked the latency involved in invoicing the Insurance Companies after 
the product was shipped and tracked the unbilled orders by their status to 
prioritize the orders that are easy to resolve.
(Medical equipment company)

© 2024 Accordion     CONFIDENTIAL
Accordion Value Add 
•
Tracked monthly patient level eligibility, resupply and delivery of the product to understand lag time, potential missed revenue, etc.
•
Provided granularity by creating additional productivity metrics to track the efficiency of the CRM
•
Tracked the ongoing integration of the CRM and the Billing systems by region, business unit and product to identify potential unbillable orders
•
Tracked the unbilled orders by their statuses to identify the process inefficiencies which are driving these unbilled orders
Situation
•
Client was facing an issue with unbilled orders because of the poor integration between CRM and Billing systems. They also had an opportunity to improve 
their CRM efficiency by effectively targeting patients for re-supply.
•
Helped drive the topline by identifying potential revenue leakages and by increasing the accuracy of patient target capabilities for resupply
Effective patient targeting and minimizing unbilled orders 
2
Impact
•
Our analyses helped the client to identify the major sources of unbilled orders and prioritize the integration between the CRM and Billing systems in those 
areas
•
Client was able to track eligible patients in real time sorted by lag time so that they can better prioritize the work-flow of the CRM 
•
It also enabled the client to assess the potential growth in topline sales and revenues directly improving the net revenue.
PATIENT TARGETING & TRACKING 
UNBILLED ORDERS

© 2024 Accordion     CONFIDENTIAL
Approach & methodology
3
CRM contacts the 
eligible patients for 
resupply 
Team ships the 
product if patient is 
compliant
‘Poor integration between 
CRM and Billing systems’ 
Billing/Invoicing 
System
Bill sent to Insurance Co.
CRM to send all the 
relevant documents to 
Billing/Invoice system
•
Created a priority list of patients based on their eligibility, region, 
Insurance Co. etc. to target them for resupply.
•
Calculated the average time taken between patient eligibility and 
product shipment, to track the CRM efficiency improvement across 
months.
•
Estimated the potential lost revenue due to time lag between the 
eligibility and resupply
•
Tracked the latency involved in invoicing the Insurance Co. after the 
product was shipped and compared it across business units and 
branches.
•
Identified the processes causing most delay by tracking the unbilled 
amounts by their status and prioritized them by ease of resolution
Client’s process
